prompt.p: A 35-year-old woman is referred by her GP with painful nodular swelling of her breasts associated with her menstrual cycle. She complains of cyclical pain and the feeling of multiple lumps in the breasts, some of which she feels are growing larger.
What is the most likely diagnosis?

modalFeedback.p: Option E is Correct. Fibroadenosis is a benign breast condition where one or more lumps are present with symptoms of pain and nodularity, which is characteristically associated with the patient's menstrual cycle. It presents in premenopausal women.
Option A is Incorrect. Breast abscess presents as a tender, swollen lump. It often has a significant amount of overlying skin erythema. There may be a fluctuant area, surrounded by induration.
Option B is Incorrect. Breast cysts are discrete, fluid-filled swellings within the breast. They are smooth and mobile and can lead to localized tenderness. They are common in premenopausal women.
Option C is Incorrect. Fat necrosis occurs following trauma to the breast. It presents as a hard lump which is attached to the skin.
Option D is Incorrect. A fibroadenoma is a benign, solitary, solid, rubbery breast lesion, which is characteristically smooth, non-tender and freely mobile. It is common in young women.
